label: Home
Functions
info:
# Functions

Contained within are reusable functions.

label: GLPI: FormCreator Automation
info:
# GLPI: FormCreator Automation
This flow search for the forms from the GLPI Plugin formcreator.
On finding a form, creates a ticket from that form.

label: Cron
info:
# Cron

This flow contains any tasks that need to be run automagically

name: Workflow: ITSM Selection
Password Reset
info:
# Password Reset Form Processing

This group is responsible for processing the data from the password reset form. the basic workflow is as follows:

- Form validation

- LDAP User Search

- ITSM User Search: if enabled searches for user within itsm system

- ITSM Ticket: if enabled, creates ticket within ITSM system

- Response: User notification

name: Authorization
Change Password
info:
# Change User Password

This group contains the workflow to change a users password within LDAP.

The workflow has th following steps:

1. Validate the form input

1. Check that the new password fields match

1. Confirm that the user entered "Current Password" matches what's in LDAP

1. Change the users password within LDAP.

name: HTTP Server
info:
# HTTP Server

This group provides the entrypoint for the application. it's broken down into further sub-groups that have their own individual responsibilities for processing a part of the HTTP servers workflow.

name: Methods
info:
# Methods

This sub-group is provides the http endpoints for the supported methods.

name: Fetch Content
info:
# Fetch Content

This sub-group is the third step in the http workflow.

Once authorized, this workflow fetches the html content to be displayed within the browser.

name: Process Forms
info:
# Process Forms

This sub-group is the third step in the http workflow.

This sub-group is responsible for processing any forms that are sent to the server.

name: Fetch Styles/JS
info:
# Fetch CSS / JS Files

This sub-group is the forth step in the http workflow, and specifically for HTTP/Get methods only.

This sub-group is responsible for fetching the appropriate CSS Style or JS Script that is required to fulfill the page request.

name: Authorization Check
info:
# Authorization Check

This group is the second step within the http workflow. 

This sub-group is responsible for ensuring that **ALL** requests to the http endpoint are authorized.

name: Form Validation
info:
# Password Reset Form Processing

This sub-group is the fist step in processing the password reset form.

for the form workflow to continue processing the form, the form user details entered, must match the authenticated users details. The details **must** match, as without this matching and by design this form can reset the password of any user where the details are correcct.

name: Form Validation
info:
# Form Validation

Validate the password change form.

name: Check Current Password
info:
# Check Current Password

Confirm that the user entered "current password" matches the LDAP value

name: Change User Password
info:
# Change User Password

Change the users password within LDAP

HTTP Method Routing
HTML
template:
Password reset Questions

For ensuring that only you can reset your password, you are required to provide three questions and answers. These questions will then as part of the self-service password reset process to confirm that it's you who is requesting the password reset.

When choosing your questions, it's important to ensure that the questions that you use, only you would know the answers. This is to ensure that no one could guess the answers as only you would know the answers.

In the fields below type out your question and answer, don't include punctuation or the use of any special characters. Valid characters are A-Z, a-z and 0-9. Any character entered into the form that are not part of this list will be removed.

On Form submission, your answers will be hashed before storage. As such, no one will be able to view the answers, this includes you. This method however, still enables us to confirm an answer to a question as would occur during the password reset process.

Results

template:

name: Create Hash Command
func:
msg.payload = 'echo -n $(echo -n ' + msg.hash.string + '| ' + msg.hash.type + 'sum) | awk \'{print $1 }\' | tr -dc \'A-Fa-f0-9\'';

return msg;

name: Save Hash Value
Build: Hash Details
Build: Hash Details
func:
msg.filename = global.get('config.paths.user_data') + msg.hash.value + '.json'

return msg;

rules.to: 'echo -n "{sha512}$(echo -n "$(echo -n ' & msg.payload &'| sha512sum)" | xxd -r -p | openssl enc -base64 | tr -dc "A-Za-z0-9+\\/=")"'

name: Description Field as Value
GLPI: Ticket Creation (ITIL Template)
info:
# Create Ticket using Ticket Template

This node is an entrypoint for the start of a workflow that uses the provided category to fetch the ticket template and use it to build the ticket.

the input object is `msg.form` with the following structure

```json
{
  "approval_required": msg.payload.data.ticket.approval_required,
  "data": msg.payload.data,
  "name": "",
  "requester_id": msg.itsm.user.id,
  "requesttypes_id": msg.payload.data.ticket.requesttype_id,
  "ticket_category": msg.payload.data.ticket.category_id,
  "ticket_entity": msg.payload.data.ticket.entity_id,
  "auto_assign": true
  "technician": 0  //Optional, int
}
```

| Property | Type | Description |
|:---|:---:|:---|
| technician | `int` | _Optional_ Set to the GLPI User id of the user to assign as the technician |

name: Assign Ticket
info:
# Assign the Ticket

This node generates the json body to assign the ticket. Currenty supports setting watcher and technician.

To assign the ticket set the following properties:

- watcher is assigned automagically and is the user who is accessing the api.

- Technician:

    - set the property `msg.form.auto_assign` to assign to the API user as the technician

    - set the property `msg.form.technician` to the id of the user to assign that user
